medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe right upper quadrant (RUQ) pain, vomiting, and fevers.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Flu-like symptoms began with mild cough and subjective fevers. Two days ago, the patient experienced severe RUQ pain after eating toast, accompanied by nausea and vomiting. No diarrhea or changes in bowel movements were noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Non-insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus (NIDDM), back surgery with rods in place, hypertension.
medical_history.family_history: Diabetes mellitus in family, aunt/grandmother with cancer of unknown origin, no known liver disease in family.
